page.title: 07A WELSH MOUNTAIN FARM. cont.
page.content: Mrs. Davies keeps her sheep mainly for meat.They are Welsh Mountain Sheep and the wool is of poor quality and does not fetch much money. The animals are {shorn }at the end of June. The wool comes off the sheep like a mat. It is then rolled into a ball, put into bags and taken to the Wool Producers of Wales in Brecon. Here it is sorted and processed. The Davies' are always busy. They get up at 6.30 each morning to fit in all the jobs. There are all sorts of things to be done but spring and summer are the busiest times of the year. Often they employ casual labourers to help particularly at lambing, shearing and hay-making time.
